# Voice & Tone Guidelines - Nathaniel Orange Portfolio

This document defines how to write content for Nathaniel's professional portfolio.

---

## üé≠ Brand Persona

**Nathaniel Orange** presents as:
- **Confident Technical Expert** - 20+ years spanning enterprise automation to cutting-edge AI
- **Innovative Problem Solver** - Multi-agent systems, workflow automation, creative AI tools
- **Versatile Professional** - Music production background + Fortune 500 experience + AI systems design
- **Continuous Learner** - Currently pursuing CS degree while building production applications

### Personality Keywords
| Do | Don't |
|----|----|
| Professional | Corporate/stuffy |
| Innovative | Buzzword-heavy |
| Approachable | Overly casual |
| Direct | Vague or hedging |
| Technical with clarity | Jargon-laden |
| Accomplished | Boastful |

---

## ‚úçÔ∏è Writing Guidelines

### Headings
- **H1, H2**: Title Case (`Featured Projects`, `Why I'm Your Next AI Innovation Lead`)
- **H3+**: Sentence case (`Education background`, `Technical skills`)

### Tone by Section

| Section | Tone | Example |
|---------|------|---------|
| **Hero** | Bold, confident | "Full Stack Developer \| Vertical AI Systems Designer" |
| **Cover Letter** | Professional, compelling | "What sets me apart is my diverse background..." |
| **Experience** | Achievement-focused | "Architected and developed the Ajantic Framework..." |
| **Projects** | Technical yet accessible | "AI-Powered Lyric Writing Studio for Music Producers" |
| **CTA** | Warm, inviting | "Let's discuss how I can help with your next project." |

### Punctuation & Grammar
- ‚úÖ Use periods for complete sentences
- ‚úÖ Use em-dashes for emphasis‚Äîlike this
- ‚úÖ Use `|` as separator in titles (not `/`)
- ‚ùå Avoid exclamation points in professional copy
- ‚ùå Avoid passive voice ("solutions were developed" ‚Üí "developed solutions")

---

## üìù Terminology Guide

### Use These Terms
| Instead of | Use |
|------------|-----|
| "Utilize" | "Use" |
| "Leverage" (as verb) | "Use" or "Apply" |
| "In order to" | "To" |
| "At this point in time" | "Now" |
| "Cutting-edge" (overused) | "Advanced" or "Modern" |
| "Synergy" | (avoid entirely) |

### Technical Terminology
When describing Nathaniel's work, use accurate technical terms:

| Area | Correct Terms |
|------|---------------|
| **AI/LLM** | Multi-agent systems, RAG pipelines, prompt optimization, LLM orchestration |
| **Frontend** | Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS |
| **Backend** | Node.js, PostgreSQL, Prisma, AWS |
| **Automation** | Workflow automation, enterprise integration, batch processing |

### Job Titles (Nathaniel's)
- ‚úÖ Full Stack Developer
- ‚úÖ Vertical AI Systems Designer
- ‚úÖ Automation Engineer
- ‚úÖ AI Framework Architect
- ‚ùå "Guru", "Ninja", "Rockstar"

---

## üìã Content Sections

### Project Descriptions
Structure: **What + How + Impact**

```markdown
‚úÖ GOOD:
"AI-Powered Lyric Writing Studio for Music Producers. A visual workflow 
builder that revolutionizes the creative process by enabling custom lyric 
generation pipelines with RAG-powered databases and multi-provider LLM integration."

‚ùå BAD:
"A really cool app that uses AI to write lyrics. It's basically like having 
a robot songwriter!"
```

### Experience Bullets
Structure: **Action Verb + What + Result**

```markdown
‚úÖ GOOD:
"Architected and developed the Ajantic Framework, enabling dynamic agent 
creation and team orchestration across multiple AI providers."

‚ùå BAD:
"Was responsible for building an AI framework."
```

### Skills Lists
- Group logically (Languages, AI/Development, Platforms)
- Order by relevance to target roles
- Include version numbers for frameworks when significant (Next.js 14, React 19)

---

## üé® Formatting Conventions

### Contact Information
```
Email: halimedetech@gmail.com
Phone: +1 (904) 252-0927
Location: Jacksonville, FL 32211
```

### Social Links
- Always include: GitHub, LinkedIn, Email
- Open in new tab with `target="_blank"` and `rel="noopener noreferrer"`

### Date Formats
- Period ranges: `2024 - Present`, `May 2016 - Jan 2022`
- Standalone years: `2024`

---

## üö´ Content Restrictions

### Never Include
- Personal political opinions
- Salary expectations
- Negative comments about past employers
- Unverified claims or metrics
- Confidential client information

### Always Include
- Accurate contact information
- Working links to projects
- Technology stack used
- Time periods for experience
